description: From Latin elixatus, past participle of elixare (“to seethe”), from elixus (“thoroughly boiled”), from e + lixare (“to boil”), lix (“ashes”).

verbs.description: elixate (third-person singular simple present elixates, present participle elixating, simple past and past participle elixated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, by extension) To extract by boiling or seething.
